definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]

sentences.english: His high notes quavered when he sang the “Internationale”.
sentences.chinese: 他唱《国际歌》时高音发颤。

sentences.english: When Saul saw the army of the Philistines, he was afraid, and his heart trembled greatly.
sentences.chinese: 扫罗看见非利士的军旅就惧怕，心中发颤。

sentences.english: Her voice quivered as she spoke.
I'm so tired that my knees are shaking.
sentences.chinese: 我实在是太累了，我的膝盖都在发颤了。

sentences.english: Dad's lower jaw trembled as he stared at the uplifted paw.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸注视着那只伸出来的爪子，下巴发颤。

sentences.english: In the lonely darkness he shivered with fright.
sentences.chinese: 他在毫无声息的黑暗里怕得全身发颤。

sentences.english: The Shu aroma once connects gold card, the jade hand trembles, or had some to challenge not trust.
sentences.chinese: 淑芬接过金卡，玉手发颤，还是有些不敢相信。

sentences.english: His voice quivered and he paused to steady it.
sentences.chinese: 他的声音发颤，于是停顿几秒来平复一下。

definition: to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]
to tremble/to shiver/uncontrolled shaking of the body
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
to weaken/to go soft (at the knees)
trill (of voice)/see also 顫聲|颤声[zhan4 sheng1]
trembling voice/see also 顫聲|颤声[chan4 sheng1]
to feel a chill (as an emotional response)/to feel cold (as a clinical symptom)
